name: Saramonic - Blink 500 Pro B5 Wireless Clip-On Microphone System with Lavalier & Dual-Channel USB-C Receiver
longDescription: The Saramonic Blink 500 Pro B5 is an advanced 2.4 GHz wireless system that provides stellar, broadcast-quality sound to Android Smartphone or Tablets, computers and iPad Pro or iPad Air with USB-C. Ideal for broadcasters, podcasters, vloggers, livestreamers, YouTube creators and filmmakers. This incredibly portable and featherweight kit comes with a single clip-on wireless transmitter with a built-in mic, a pro-grade lavalier microphone, a device-mountable dual-channel receiver and a portable charging carry case. The receiver mounts directly to the USB-C port of your Android Mobile Device, Computer or iPad Pro/Air, providing a digital connection right to the device. It is so compact and lightweight; you can add fully functional wireless system to your Android smartphone or tablet, without any mounting accessories or adding significant weight. Letting you easily mic yourself or someone else, and if you ever need to put mics on two people, you can simply add a second Blink 500 Pro TX wireless transmitter (sold separately) and make it a 2-person wireless system. Truly Professional, Next Generation 2.4 GHz Wireless System The Blink 500 Pro B5 is the next generation of the immensely successful Blink 500 system. Combining the revolutionary design, ease of use and industry leading flexibility of the original system with an updated design, headphone output, OLED displays, longer battery life, expanded range, elevated sound quality and an impressive list of new pro features that set it apart from the original Blink 500 system and competitors. While still being remarkably easy to use. So, you can literally just turn it on and start recording. For Android Mobile Devices, Computers, and iPad Pro or iPad Air with USB-C The Blink 500 Pro B5 system’s RXUC Pro dual-channel receiver plugs right in and mounts to the device’s USB-C port. Allowing the system to work perfectly with your Android smartphone or tablet, computer and even iPad Pros or iPad Airs with USB-C. A 3.5mm headphone output lets you monitor the sound in real-time, even if your app does not allow real-time monitoring. Absolutely vital to ensure you’re getting the best sound when recording and finally allowing you to hear the other participants in virtual meetings, video calls and virtual classroom applications in real-time. The RXUC Pro also features a much-desired selectable Mono / Stereo output setting, giving you the ability record each mic to separate channels of device’s video or audio recording app, when using an additional TX transmitter (sold separately) The Tiny, but Mighty TX Transmitter The Blink 500 Pro TX transmitter is ridiculously compact and lightweight, yet it delivers high-quality professional sound, anyway you want to use it. It features a built-in omnidirectional microphone with an impressive sensitivity of -39dB. Giving you dynamic, crystal-clear sound quality on a transmitter that you can easily clip to a shirt, collar or slide into a pocket, yet versatile enough to set on a table or podium. The TX transmitter also operates as a traditional bodypack transmitter with the included SR-M1 professional omnidirectional lavalier microphone, providing an even more visually discreet miking solution. It can also be used handheld, by itself or with the optional Blink500 Pro HM Handheld Mic Holder (sold separately). Mic or Line, It’s All Fine As an added unique and amazing feature, the Blink 500 Pro TX transmitter also allows you to transmit microphone-level or line-level signal wirelessly and provides plug-in power to microphones. This makes the system tremendously versatile allowing you to connect it to virtually any audio source. You can use the included SR-M1 lavalier or plug in a mini-shotgun microphone, you can add a headset microphone, or a higher-end lavalier. Just about any 3.5mm microphone wired for standard TRS pin-out will work, and the adjustable mic gain lets you get perfect levels every time. Switch the TX transmitter to line-level and connect it to mixers, music players, or any line-level device output you want to transmit wirelessly to the receiver. Unmatched Power and Range, Paired with Sophisticated Simplicity The Blink 500 Pro B5 takes power and range to a higher level. With an expanded range of up to 328-feet (100m) and the expanded transmitter battery life of up to 8-hours, users now have the freedom for wider, more expansive shots without fear of dropouts and have the ability to shoot for an entire day on one charge.

name: Bones [DVD] [2001]
longDescription: Urban drama and horror come together in the Snoop Dogg vehicle Bones. New Line has done a fantastic job on this nearly flawless 2.35:1 anamorphic widescreen transfer. No grain, dirt, edge enhancement, or digital artifacting is spotted anywhere on this disc. All of the colors, flesh tones, and black levels look very vibrant and even. The audio is presented in Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround EX, DTS 6.1, and Dolby 2.0 Surround, all in English. The DTS and Dolby 5.1 soundtracks both sound extremely bombastic and full. The surround feature on each of these mixes is utilized extensively through the front and rear speakers to maximum effect. All aspects of the dialogue, effects, and music are clear of any distortion or hiss. Also included on this disc are English subtitles. Bones is presented in New Line's "Platinum Edition" and features lots of goodies for fans to peruse through. The first is a commentary track by director Ernest Dickerson, writer Adam Simon, and star Snoop Dogg. While this is a somewhat dull track with some lulls in the feature, there are some interesting behind-the-scenes tidbits shared with the viewer. Fourteen deleted scenes are next totaling about 24 minutes. Some of these cut scenes are fairly interesting, while others are just boring. Two rather long featurettes titled "Digging up Bones" and "Urban Gothic: Bones and Its Influences," are very in-depth looks at both the production of the film as well as where the idea for Bones sprung from. Rounding out the extra features are two music videos, one live and one filmed, by Snoop Dogg, as well as some info on the cast and crew and a theatrical trailer presented in anamorphic widescreen. Watch your back and get your hands on this great edition of Bones.

name: The Odd Couple: The Third Season [4 Discs] [DVD]
longDescription: This reviewer had forgotten just how good the series The Odd Couple looked -- then he saw this four-disc set encompassing the complete Season Three of the program. After decades of cut and badly transferred syndication copies, it was refreshing to see the deep, solid colors of the original negatives finally re-captured. There are no frills or bonus materials on this set, just the 23 episodes, each of which gets a half-dozen chapter-markers. The full-screen (1.33-to-1) image is crisp and bright, and the sound is full and well-balanced. The restoration of sequences that were long cut (to increase the room for commercials in syndication) also restores certain incidental jokes and sight-gags that have been missing since the original network run of the series. The first disc features an annoying super-menu, requiring one to choose the actual disc menu (rather than a selection of CBS Video trailers), but at least the program menu allows one a "play all" optionm in addition to individual episode selections.

In keeping with the other complete box sets of the series, disc seven contains a plentiful choice of special features with tons of interviews and behind-the-scenes footage. "New Frontiers: The Story of Deep Space Nine" is a 15-minute discussion about the show's creation. "New Stations, New Ships" is a five-minute look at the visual effects and several ship designs. "Michael Westmore's Aliens: Season Two" is a 12-minute peek into the makeup room, while "DS9 Sketchbook" is an 11-minute tour of the sets. Finally, "Crew Dossier: Jadzia Dax" is a 17-minute conversation with actress Terry Farrell. This boxed set is highly recommended for serious fans of the show.
